channel.title: Explorer.exe help
channel.description:
I don't know if this is the right spot or not.. But earlier my explorer.exe froze, so I ended the process and let it reload like it normally does.. But this time it didn't load anything, I manually loaded it, and nothing happened besides it opened up 'My Documents'.
So I shut off my computer, turned it back on after 30 minutes.. It loads up etc.. My background appears, and the explorer.exe is not in the processes, when i reload it, all it does is open 'My Documents'... I search on a comp tech forums, and nothing there shows any fix for this problem.. I virus scanned the comp, nothing was found.. Turned my firewall's on High, and allow no exceptions.. And tried to reboot the explorer.exe, and normally my firewalls will show a box asking me if i want it to start up, and well it didn't.. It just opened 'My Documents' again..
Does anyone know why it is doing this? And what I can do to fix it..
Please respond soon.

item.title: Explorer.exe help
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

If you would stop downloading files like: “naked_little_gurl.jpg.exe” you would never have this problem…

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe help
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Windows key + R > CMD > start explorer.exe

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe help
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Needs process dump.
Maybe some virus is injecting or removed dynamic link libraries into explorer.exe
Since you have done a virus scan its most likely that a dll is missing.

Personally, I would just transfer files(with live cd) and re-install windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Explorer.exe help
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:8, topic:322603”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=418989.msg3078930#msg3078930 date=1262032196]
ruffles im a narb, i have to say.
But you should still delete system32 to fix the problem.
[/quote]
because it’s easy to remove files that you can’t remove in windows.[/quote]
&& are write protected.

@OP: not sure exactly what would be causing that - if you start an explorer process and it opens the file-system browser but the reload the task bar, then something is seriously wrong. This is why I hate windows for making everything revolve around one process.

Read full topic
